Package io.github.btj.termios

Class Terminal

java.lang.Object
io.github.btj.termios.Terminal
public class Terminal extends Object

  • Method Summary

    Method

    static void
    clearScreen()
    Requests the terminal to clear the screen.
    static void
    enterRawInputMode()
    Put the terminal in a mode where it reports key presses immediately rather than buffering them until Return is pressed or otherwise processing them.
    static void

    Put the terminal back into the mode that was active when enterRawInputMode was last called.

  • Method Details

    • enterRawInputMode

      public static void enterRawInputMode()
      Put the terminal in a mode where it reports key presses immediately rather than buffering them until Return is pressed or otherwise processing them.

    • readByte

      public static int readByte() throws IOException
      Read a byte from standard input. This may be an ASCII character, (a part of) a (presumably UTF-8-encoded) non-ASCII character, or (part of) a control sequence. Run the raw input test to experimentally determine which bytes are generated by which keypresses.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • leaveRawInputMode

      public static void leaveRawInputMode()
      Put the terminal back into the mode that was active when enterRawInputMode was last called.

    • reportTextAreaSize

      public static void reportTextAreaSize()
      Requests the terminal to report the size of the text area to standard input. Will be reported as CSI 8 ; height ; width t where CSI is "\033[".

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Requests the terminal to clear the screen.

    • moveCursor

      public static void moveCursor(int row, int column, String text)
      Requests the terminal to move the cursor to the given row and column (1-based).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given row or column are less than 1.

    • printText

      public static void printText(int row, int column, String text)
      Requests the terminal to print the given text at the given row and column (both 1-based). This also moves the cursor, but if the last character printed is in the last column of the text area, the resulting cursor position is not well-defined. Note: printing to the last column of the last row of the text area might cause the terminal to scroll and should therefore be avoided.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given row or column are less than 1.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given text contains characters whose value is less than 32 or greater than 126.
